body: I have no idea on this one - @nicoddemus @RonnyPfannschmidt could one of you take a look at what's wrong there?
so much for that evening, fetching the details now

discovered a bug in bestrelpath

when it goes up to the root, then it will return a relative path that is longer than the rest
@bluetech i believe the issue could have gotten introduced while changing our commonpath usage to the stdlib, creating a test+fix now

@The-Compiler i made the fixture output better by fixing the bestrelpath for root == commonpath on posix,

additionally im introducing a PYTHON_SITE meta env var for better handling
@The-Compiler i  discovered that for some reason the python  prefix is used as pytest cache dire
it seems this first cropped up in 2019 and was back then incorrectly resolved by adding a `rm -rf`
I don't really follow. @RonnyPfannschmidt what's the state of this? FWIW I don't think this should block a release candidate, but I do think we should fix it for the final.
I have not been able to allocate time to go down the rabbit hole, I suspect a path normalising bug, wipe won't help as the pytest cache dir completely miss detected, its absolutely unclear

> wipe won't help as the pytest cache dir completely miss detected, its absolutely unclear

You mean deleting `.pytest_cache` didn't work, or were you unable to do it while running regendoc? Seems just deleting would solve it, otherwise from where would that cache information come from?

@nicoddemus the pytest_cache is not in a regendoc tmpdir but in the actual tox virtualenv, i have no idea how/why

when the error first appeared it was simply fixeds in a very broken way, and now with the renamed  files its just hitting harder/worse
